unnormalised: ## Ditch the Couch, Hit the Fest: Your Guide to Film Festivals!
normalised: ## Ditch the Couch, Hit the Fest: Your Guide to Film Festivals!

unnormalised: Hey movie buffs! Tired of the same old Bollywood masala playing on repeat? Wanna see something different, something real, something...*arty*? Then listen up, because film festivals are where it's at!
normalised: Hey movie buffs! Tired of the same old Bollywood masala playing on repeat? Wanna see something different, something real, something...*arty*? Then listen up, because film festivals are where it's at!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as a giant buffet for your eyes and ears. You've got your big hitters like Cannes and Venice (we all dream of walking that red carpet, right?), but also tons of smaller, cooler fests popping up everywhere, even right here in India. We've got the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa which is a must-visit, showcasing movies from all over the globe. And tons of regional ones too!
normalised: Think of film festivals as a giant buffet for your eyes and ears. You've got your big hitters like Cannes and Venice (we all dream of walking that red carpet, right?), but also tons of smaller, cooler fests popping up everywhere, even right here in India. We've got the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa which is a must-visit, showcasing movies from all over the globe. And tons of regional ones too!

unnormalised: What's so great about them? Well, for starters, you get to see films that you'd probably *never* find at your local PVR. Indie flicks, documentaries that’ll blow your mind, short films that pack a serious punch – the variety is insane. Plus, you might just stumble upon the next Anurag Kashyap before he hits the big time!

unnormalised: Beyond the films, it's the whole *vibe*. You're surrounded by other movie lovers, filmmakers, critics, and maybe even some actual stars! It's a chance to geek out over cinema, debate plot twists, and maybe even network a little if you're aspiring to be the next Karan Johar.

unnormalised: Pro tip: Don't be afraid to try something outside your comfort zone. You might discover a genre you never knew you loved! Also, book your tickets early, especially for the popular screenings. And remember to pack comfortable shoes – you'll be doing a lot of walking between screenings!

unnormalised: Last year at the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival, I saw this absolutely bonkers German film about… well, I’m not even sure what it was about, but it was unforgettable!
normalised: Last year at the Jio M A M I Mumbai Film Festival, I saw this absolutely bonkers German film about… well, I’m not even sure what it was about, but it was unforgettable!

unnormalised: So, ditch the couch, grab your friends, and hit up a film festival near you. You won't regret it! Trust me, it's way more exciting than another re-run of *DDLJ*. Plus you can eat way better vada pav than at your home for Rs. 20 a piece. Maybe drive 500 km for one? It’s worth it!
